trans-unit.source: Typically, debugging a kernel-mode driver requires two computers.
trans-unit.target: Typically, debugging a kernel-mode driver requires two computers.

trans-unit.source: The debugger runs on the *host computer*, and the code being debugged runs on the *target computer*.
trans-unit.target: The debugger runs on the *host computer*, and the code being debugged runs on the *target computer*.

trans-unit.source: The target computer is also called the *test computer*.
trans-unit.target: The target computer is also called the *test computer*.

trans-unit.source: You can debug a user-mode driver on the host computer or on a separate target computer.
trans-unit.target: You can debug a user-mode driver on the host computer or on a separate target computer.

trans-unit.source: Before you can debug a driver running on a target computer, you must configure the target computer for debugging.
trans-unit.target: Before you can debug a driver running on a target computer, you must configure the target computer for debugging.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a target computer and setting up a debug cable, see [Setting Up Kernel-Mode Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439376) and [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a target computer and setting up a debug cable, see [Setting Up Kernel-Mode Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439376) and [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: For information about using Microsoft Visual Studio to debug a driver, see [Debugging Using Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh406281).
trans-unit.target: For information about using Microsoft Visual Studio to debug a driver, see [Debugging Using Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh406281).

trans-unit.source: For an example of using Visual Studio to debug a kernel-mode driver, see [Writing a KMDF driver based on a template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439654).
trans-unit.target: For an example of using Visual Studio to debug a kernel-mode driver, see [Writing a KMDF driver based on a template](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439654).

trans-unit.source: For an introduction to Debugging Tools for Windows, see [Windows Debugging](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff551063).
trans-unit.target: For an introduction to Debugging Tools for Windows, see [Windows Debugging](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff551063).

trans-unit.source: This video demonstrates how to use the WinDbg debugging engine directly in Visual Studio instead of running WinDbg separately.
trans-unit.target: This video demonstrates how to use the WinDbg debugging engine directly in Visual Studio instead of running WinDbg separately.
